titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Photographs of vacant lots in Gowanus V1990.073
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:09:29 +0000.

did.unittitle: Photographs of vacant lots in Gowanus

physdesc.extent: two items housed in one folder.

did.abstract: The Photographs of vacant lots in Gowanus consist of two modern black-and-white photographic prints (reproductions) of Library of Congress photographs showing vacant lots in the Gowanus neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1920. The photographs show the area near 2nd Street and 4th Avenue and include views of vacant lots, views of distant buildings surrounding the lots, and views of people working in the lots.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Photographs of vacant lots in Gowanus, V1990.073, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Photographs of vacant lots in Gowanus consist of two modern black-and-white photographic prints (reproductions) of Library of Congress photographs showing vacant lots in the Gowanus neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1920. The photographs show the area near 2nd Street and 4th Avenue and include views of vacant lots, views of distant buildings surrounding the lots, and views of people working in the lots.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the photographs have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1990.
